name: EventStorming
description:
EventStorming is an approach to implementing Domain Driven Design (DDD) software. Instead of sitting in front of a whiteboard and trying to come up with every possible scenario, participants go through a series of steps with group support to brainstorm the various ways that people use the application. The goal is to generate functional understanding between stakeholders and developers, not simply specify a solution. By bridging business language, technical knowledge, and behavior patterns, it's intended that events, functions, and objects can be defined collaboratively.


This short cheat-sheet covers some basics of event storming, including how to host a workshop, what to write on sticky notes, and how to capture stories in different levels of detail.
